column4: Anyone know anything about alsa audio drivers ? Need help debugging my no-audio issue :/ http://www.alsa-project.org/db/?f=093cfd18ead70526bc477a48d6aad53f84a74d99
I'll need more than "no sound" to help you :)
aplay -l lists my sound card, alsamixer also allows me to mess with levels, but the actual vol control only shows the 'dummy output' hardware playback device, not my REAL card
someone had a similar issue here, with very similar hardware: https://answers.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/alsa-driver/+question/190509 but their solution did not appear to help me
I'm guessing you're using regular ubuntu 12.04? then it's probably PulseAudio's fault...
buhman: i'm not exactly sure what belongs in this new asound.conf file i had to create.
here's mine, I have dual soundcards thou and is set the card #2... : http://codepad.org/GXGUmC08

hmm. Neither .asoundrc or /etc/asound.conf is normally required. You should be able to play and record sound without either (assuming your mic and speakers are hooked up properly). If your system won't work without one, and you are running the most current version of ALSA, you probably should file a bug report. lol, should i file a bug report ??

so my .asoundrc file simply reads "pcm.card0 { type hw  card 0 }" . also, only reason why i was mentioning asound.conf earlier is because buhman mentioned earlier the change i would be required to make would be in there. After adding those few lines above, is there anything i have to restart?
buhman was refering to 2 separate files, not a file in a directory :) and no, nothing has to be restarted :)
so, there is an 'asound.conf' i have to create/modify somewhere ? Still no audio :/
what's next? i'm not sure what i should be trying here
found your problem... it's a Dell ^^
NO! this was before it was dell ;)
